## Welcome

I am a **post-doctoral researcher** at the [Centre Européen de Sociologie et de Science Politique (CESSP)](https://cessp.cnrs.fr/) and resident at the [Centre for Complex Systems (ISC-PIF)](https://iscpif.fr/), where I develop Clinical Decision Support Systems (CDSS) for PTSD detection through Natural Language Processing.

I hold a **Ph.D. in Computer Science** from [École Pratique des Hautes Études (EPHE)](https://www.ephe.psl.eu/) and currently lead the **150k€ CNRS-funded TALANT project** on trauma language analysis.

## Research Interests

My research focuses on applying computational methods to understand and detect mental health conditions through language analysis:

- **Natural Language Processing for Mental Health**: Developing NLP techniques to identify linguistic markers of psychological conditions
- **Clinical Decision Support Systems (CDSS)**: Creating AI-powered tools to assist healthcare professionals in diagnosis and treatment
- **Trauma and PTSD Detection**: Analyzing language patterns to identify and understand post-traumatic stress disorder
- **Psycholinguistics**: Investigating the relationship between language and psychological states
- **Explainable AI**: Ensuring transparency and interpretability in AI systems for healthcare applications

### TALANT Project
I am the Principal Investigator of the **TALANT** (Traitement Automatique du LANgage Traumatique) project, a 150k€ CNRS Innovation Prematuration Grant focused on developing automated tools for trauma language analysis. This interdisciplinary project combines computational linguistics, psychology, and clinical research to advance our understanding of trauma through language.
